thread.title: Virat Kohli century helps India beat South Africa
thread.title_full: Virat Kohli century helps India beat South Africa

title: Virat Kohli century helps India beat South Africa
text:
Virat Kohli century helps India beat South Africa 22 Oct 2015 17:16:57 
comments 
Virat Kohli helped India keep the Freedom Series against South Africa alive with an impressive ODI display in Chennai. 
An imposing 138 from the bat saw the 26-year-old inspire the hosts to victory against the Proteas, levelling the overall score at 2-2. 
India ended their innings at 299 for eight - a score South Africa were unable to reach, finishing 35 runs short despite AB de Villiers' score of 112. 
The hosts took a while to get going as openers Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan were kept quite, with the former caught off Chris Morris before the latter was thwarted by Quinton de Kock after edging Kagiso Rabada. 
Kohli was starting to get into the groove, though, and set a solid foundation with Ajinkya Rahan, who Dale Steyn got caught behind to end a 107-run partnership. 
Suresh Raina and Kohli produced another century stand, with the formed eventually out for 53 runs to the bowling of Steyn. 
Rabada got Kohli caught behind for 138 and, while MS Dhoni and Bhuvneshwar Kumar quickly fell, India finished on 299 for eight. 
De Kock got the visitors off to a good start, but fell with Faf du Plessis and David Miller in quick succession to the spin of Harbhajan Singh and Axar Patel. 
De Villiers was easily the standout player for the Proteas, contributing 112 off 107 balls to claim a national record 22nd ODI century. 
When he eventually fell during the 45th over, it was clear South Africa would fall short and were restricted to 264 for nine. 
The ODI series decider takes place on Sunday at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. Related Sport News
